author: Arian Chicana
title: Extranjera critica el sabor de productos peruanos y desata polémica en redes: "Sin ningún sabor"
text:
Extranjera critica el sabor de productos peruanos y desata polémica en redes: “Sin ningún sabor”
Algunos usuarios apoyaron sus críticas, pero otros defendieron la gastronomía peruana y le sugirieron que explore su diversidad antes de juzgar sus sabores.
Las redes sociales estallaron en polémica luego de que una influencer extranjera compartiera su opinión sobre algunos productos peruanos, asegurando que carecen de sabor. En un video viral, la joven probó diversos alimentos y expresó su descontento con frases como “sin ningún sabor”, lo que generó una ola de reacciones entre los usuarios peruanos, quienes defendieron la riqueza gastronómica del país.
Los comentarios no tardaron en dividirse entre quienes apoyaban su punto de vista y aquellos que la criticaban por no haber probado productos auténticos o no haber considerado la diversidad de sabores en el Perú. Algunos usuarios le recomendaron volver a explorar la gastronomía del Perú antes de emitir su opinión de forma ligera, mientras que otros solo se dedicaron a defender la comida peruana.
PUEDES VER:
[Los mejores memes que dejó el partido entre Universitario y el Inter de Miami de Lionel Messi]
¿Cuál era su percepción sobre los peruanos?
La ciudadana rusa explicó en su video la mala experiencia que tuvo al probar algunos de los productos de la gastronomía peruana. Al parecer, ya se imaginaba lo que sucedería al hacer comentarios negativos sobre la comida peruana, ya que al inicio mencionó lo siguiente: "Yo sé que los peruanos son muy sensibles con la comida cuando les critican, te van a insultar".
¿Qué alimentos peruanos criticó?
Tras una breve introducción, empezó a nombrar ciertos productos y vegetales que probó durante su estancia en Perú, "las aceitunas son grandotas, pero son horribles. De verdad, son muy amargos, no sé, tú comes y es imposible pasar. Los pepinos en Perú son enormes, pero sin ningún sabor, sin ningún crocante. Solo comes para comer algo. No sé, no me gusta, disculpa".
PUEDES VER:
[Dejó su carrera de ingeniería en la UNI para estudiar contabilidad en la PUCP y fundar La Lucha y Siete Sopas: Gastón fue su primer cliente]
Al final del video, dio su opinión acerca del tomate que se produce en Perú, "son muy secos y otra vez de ningún sabor. No sé, yo no siento ningún sabor. No es jugo, es agua lo que está por dentro. Probablemente, no he comprado de los mejores, pero esto no es tomate, es una imitación de tomate".
¿Cómo reaccionaron en las redes?
Hubo diversas reacciones en redes sociales. Por un lado, existían comentarios que apoyaban a la mujer de Rusia: "¡Bien dicho, amiga! Solo el ceviche, el pollo y el saltado de res es lo que ellos tienen, muy rico, pero no son los mejores en gastronomía".
Sin embargo, la mayoría fueron en defensa de la gastronomía peruana: "Cada país tiene lo suyo. y debemos ser respetuosos con las diferentes culturas gastronómicas. hay paladar para todos los gustos", "Que sigan hablando, hay alguien mas que hable como ella? pues que lo hagan les agradezco por tenernos siempre presentes, gracias por dedicarnos su tiempo", "no te gusta, bueno se respeta" o como "la comida peruana es RIQUÍSIMA".
¿Qué verduras se consumen más en Rusia?
Los rusos consumen una variedad de verduras básicas y resistentes al frío, esenciales en su gastronomía. Entre las más comunes están la papa, zanahoria, remolacha y repollo, ingredientes clave en platos tradicionales como el borsch (sopa de remolacha) y la ensalada Olivier. También son populares la cebolla y el ajo, utilizados para dar sabor a guisos y carnes.
En verano, aumenta el consumo de pepinos, tomates, pimientos, rábanos y calabacines, que suelen servirse frescos en ensaladas o encurtidos para el invierno. Además, los rusos utilizan hierbas como el eneldo, perejil y cebollín, muy presentes en su cocina. A pesar del clima frío, el uso de invernaderos y técnicas de conservación permite que muchas verduras estén disponibles durante todo el año.

author: Janet Guan
title: Here’s why ‘any ol’ blender’ won’t do if you’re blending soup
text:
If you love creamy pumpkin soup in the winter, you’ll want to invest in the correct
 kitchen appliances to help you create your favourite winter dish. And while some may think any ol’ blen d er will do when it comes to blending soup (or hot liquids), we’re here to tell you – and warn you – any ol’ blender absolutely won’t do. In fact, it’s incredibly dangerous to blend hot liquids in a blender that is not designed to do so.
What are the best blenders for hot soups?
Hot liquids, like
soups or purees, can expand during the blending process and, for lack of a better word, explode, when you use a blender that isn’t designed for hot liquids. Therefore, hot liquids in a normal blender is a recipe for disaster. However, there are specialty blenders, namely, hot and cold blenders, that are designed to handle both hot and cold liquids.
What are hot and cold blenders?
Given their name, hot and cold blenders are designed to blend both hot and cold liquids with ease. These blenders are made from high-quality glass that is heat resistant. Further, hot and cold blenders often have extra safety elements such as a lid lock or overheating protection/sensors. Some high-tech models also include a heating feature within the appliance so you can cook your soup with the blender.
2024’s top hot and cold blenders
- Ninja Foodi cold and hot blender, $299 (usually $399), Myer (
[here’s why](#1))
- Kleva Mealio hot and cold blender, $197, Amazon (
[here’s why](#2))
- Tefal Perfectmix hot and cold blender, $279.66, Amazon (
[here’s why](#3))
The best hot and cold blenders 2024
Ready to blitz up your soups, purees, and more ASAP? Below, we’ve rounded up the best hot and cold blenders to shop in Australia this year.

Ninja Foodi cold and hot blender
$299 (usually $399),
Myer
With a 1000-watt motor for cold blending and an 800-watt precision heating element for hot liquids, the Ninja Foodi can help you craft delicious cocktails and hearty soups. It features 10 preset Auto-iQ smart programs that allow you to master your favourite recipes—all with the touch of a button.
Key features:
- 1000-watt motor base

With eight blending modes, an intelligent touch panel, and a triple-lock safety lid, this hot and cold blender from Kleva is a must-have for winter recipes. Plus, it comes with a free recipe book containing 30 hot and cold recipes for you to try come dinnertime.

The Tefal Perfectmix features 10 automatic programs (four cold and six hot) to create the perfect smoothie, sauces, soups, and more. Plus, the Perfectmix uses a powerful 1400-watt motor for smooth and creamy results every time.
“It makes excellent smooth soups in half an hour. The self-cleaning cycle includes boiling and can be opened up further for cleaning. If you’re using potatoes for soup, it works well when chopped up very small for even cooking,” commented a five-star reviewer.
Key features:

Vitamix Ascent Series A23000i blender
$825 (usually $1099),
https://www.amazon.com.au/Vitamix-Blender-Professional-Grade-Low-Profile-Container/dp/B07FP63PLZ/?tag=homestolove00-22
Sleek and stylish, the Vitamix Ascent Series blender features easy-to-use controls and a handy built-in timer for the best results. With 10 variable speeds and a pulse function to choose from, you’ll be able to tackle purees, chunky salsas, sauces and more with ease. The Vitamix blender can heat your soup up (without a stove) in just under 10 minutes. How does this work? You ask. The answer is simple. The friction from the blades as it blends your soup ingredients together can bring the soup to a nice and hot serving temperature – now talk about handy!
Key features:

05
Magimix 5XL Power Blender
$509 (usually $599),
https://myer.sjv.io/c/3001951/1279730/15706?subId1=htl&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.myer.com.au%2Fp%2Fmagimix-blender-power-5xl-in-silver
Crafted from thermal shock-resistant borosilicate glass, the 5XL Power Blender from Magimix is perfect for desserts, smoothies, and, you guessed it, soups. With four speed settings and a turbo-pulse function to ensure the creamiest of textures, you’ll be blitzing up restaurant-quality recipes faster than ever.
Key features:

author: Tyler A. McNeil
title: Feds: Diner review helped ID man in Biden death threat | News | dailygazette.com
text: ALBANY — An ambivalent Schoharie County restaurant review helped federal authorities track down a man who allegedly posted a series of death threats against President Joe Biden on social media. Investigators linked open-sourced information from 19-year-old Troy Kelly’s X account — @CountryBoyTroy0 — to a four-month-old Google review of the Cobleskill Diner, according to court documents. “I love eating here,” one post reads. “Wonderful service and people [sic] great setting and looks. However I've gotten sick a few times from the sea food. Everything I order it I get sick.” Authorities discovered that Kelly previously lived in Cobleskill and currently resides in Crown Point, Essex County. Two state police investigators, a trooper and a U.S. Secret Service agent on June 19 visited his home, where Kelly allegedly admitted to threatening to "put a bullet in” the president’s head over X. That profanity-laced post was from May 17. Officials, after the encounter, unearthed two other public death threats against Biden on his account, court records show. “I asked KELLY why he wants to kill President Biden and KELLY replied by saying that President Biden and his son are a disgrace,” Secret Service agent William Henry wrote in a criminal complaint. Hunter Biden is the only one of the president’s sons still alive, as his son Beau Biden died of brain cancer in 2015. Hunter was recently convicted of felony charges related to lying about his drug use upon buying a firearm. With consent provided by Kelly’s father, the property owner, officials entered the home. They seized two unsecured black powder rifles leaning up against a bedroom wall under an extreme risk protection order. Kelly on Monday was charged with threatening the president — a charge that comes with a $250,000 fine and maximum prison sentence of five years, if convicted. He was arrested on Tuesday and is currently in the custody of U.S. Marshals. On Friday, the teenager is scheduled for a detention hearing.

author: Katie Mather, Yahoo News
title: Viral pop culture X account Pop Tingz made Julie Ragbeer a star. Now more young artists want to pay for a chance at fame. – Boston 25 News
text:
By Katie Mather, Yahoo News February 29, 2024 at 4:30 pm EST By Katie Mather, Yahoo News February 29, 2024 at 4:30 pm EST When Julie Ragbeer wrote the lyrics for her album Perplex six years ago, it's doubtful she expected hundreds of thousands of people on X, formerly known as Twitter, to describe her as a " queen ."
Ragbeer, 24, is a college student from New Jersey who has been trying to break into the music industry since she was 19. Perplex came out in 2023, and she told Yahoo News she recorded it in her bedroom. ("I've never been to an actual music studio.") As someone who grew up on the internet, she knew that one of the cheapest ways to get noticed — potentially by the right person — was to go viral. She has been running a Taylor Swift stan account for years and knew she just had to tap into the right audience.
So she decided to pay an undisclosed amount of money to Pop Tingz , a popular X account that's similar to but unaffiliated with Pop Crave or Pop Base , which operates by posting celebrity news and updates. The staff for Pop Crave and Pop Base are anonymous, and while there are websites attached to them, the accounts rarely post links or sources, which allows them the flexibility to sometimes break serious news .
. @JulieRagbeer reminisces with her 19 year old experiences in her new debut album. pic.twitter.com/wYAfzYb6tl
— Pop Tingz (@ThePopTingz) February 22, 2024 However, Pop Tingz clarified to Yahoo News over X direct messages that their account is run by one person, unlike Pop Crave or Pop Base. The person running the account did not reveal their name with Yahoo News. Pop Tingz has 165,000 followers, while Pop Crave and Pop Base each have well over 1 million.
Paying for promotion Ragbeer said she's paid for X promotion before. In 2019, she allegedly paid an undisclosed amount to Pop Crave for a post, which was deleted as recently as Feb. 26 . In mid-February, she decided she was going to try again and reached out to several X accounts to promote her music. Neither Pop Crave nor Pop Base responded to a request for comment from Yahoo News.
“When you're an independent artist, you kind of have to [pay for promotion],” she told Yahoo News, adding she paid for everything out of pocket. “I had a very strict budget. So I chose some accounts that [didn’t] work out and, thankfully, Pop Tingz was very accommodating.”
Ragbeer did not feel comfortable divulging how much she paid for the Pop Tingz post. Despite X jokes about payment being $5 , Pop Tingz told Yahoo News that they usually charge anywhere from $100 to $500 for a promotional post. The cheaper end of the spectrum is reserved for artists who have been promoted on Pop Tingz more than once.
The promotion far surpassed Ragbeer's expectations. She told Yahoo News that she had 20 X followers when she first messaged Pop Tingz, and she now has over 9,000. People started making memes about her , and the promotional Pop Tingz tweet has over 11 million views.
julie ragbeer probably spent like 5 dollars for that pop tingz post and now she’s a niche gay icon how can you not say mother pic.twitter.com/Or8IwLon3E
— dorathy (@dorathydotmp4) February 25, 2024 “I thought maybe I would get like a few fans or a few listeners from this and then it just blew up,” Ragbeer said. “I've been messaged about doing collaborations, so I'm definitely thinking about that. But I also don't want to over-release [music] at the same time.”
The person behind Pop Tingz didn’t expect it either. In fact, they said they went out on a limb to promote Ragbeer in the first place.
“I’m selective with my posts and I don’t post just anyone who pays,” they told Yahoo News. “I’m usually a fan of their work or enjoy their art. Julie happened to be an outlier.”
More up-and-coming artists request Pop Tingz promotion Before long Pop Tingz was flooded with requests from other up-and-coming young independent artists who wanted to ride Ragbeer's wave. Sebastian Akselberg, 19, a music producer based in Norway who worked on a couple of Ragbeer's songs, made a new X account just to get promoted by Pop Tingz. Ragbeer described their relationship as "like Jack Antonoff and Taylor Swift."
“We met on Twitter,” Akselberg told Yahoo News. “In 2018, I had a fan page for Ariana Grande and she had a fan page for Taylor Swift and that's how we met. She mentioned she was doing music. And I said, ‘Oh, I'm doing music as well.’”
Akselberg said he had no idea Ragbeer was reaching out to X accounts for promotion. He said one morning he woke up and came across several posts about Ragbeer on Reddit and X.
“I texted her, I was like, ‘Why are you on Reddit right now?’ She's like, ‘Oh, I went viral,’” he said. “I thought this was a joke.”
Akselberg wanted in and messaged Pop Tingz too. Akselberg did not tell Yahoo News how much money he paid to be promoted but did send screenshots of the PayPal receipt to verify he had paid the account.
Julie Ragbeer producer, Sebastian Akselberg ( @SebastianA60054 ), teases his own music!
Presave below: https://t.co/6tvRIr3h3K pic.twitter.com/E9dFpjqpD9
— Pop Tingz (@ThePopTingz) February 26, 2024 Another young artist, Carlos Edwards, told Yahoo News that she reached out to Pop Tingz after seeing how much buzz Ragbeer got on X. She did not disclose how much she paid for her promotional tweet .
“I’m an artist, so any chance at promotion to get people to hear my art I’ll take,” she said.
Lightning did not strike multiple times, however. While Ragbeer exploded on the internet, Akselberg and Edwards saw only small bumps in followers and streams.
But despite the very modern way they were promoted to the masses, both Ragbeer and Akselberg had very old-school markers for success they hoped to achieve. Ragbeer wants to hear her music on the radio; Akselberg wants to have his own vinyl.
Akselberg also clarified that it was never “a secret” that people could direct-message big accounts like Pop Tingz and pay for promotion.
Why aren’t the X posts labeled as ads? Pop Tingz did not disclose in the tweets that they had been paid to promote the singers. While some of the X replies and Akselberg's statement seem to allege it's never been a secret that people could pay for promotion on X, these are still advertisements that aren't being disclosed.
Pop Tingz did not reply to a question from Yahoo News about labeling the tweets as ads.
However, there have been conversations about X's ethics regarding ads since Elon Musk took over the company in 2022. In October, Mashable pointed out that many users were noticing ads that weren't specific to a brand nor labeled as paid promotions. X did not respond to a Yahoo News request for comment.
The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has rules in place holding social media companies and influencers accountable for ensuring that all ads are labeled " clearly and conspicuously ."
“If you endorse a product through social media, your endorsement message should make it obvious when you have a relationship (‘material connection’) with the brand,” the FTC says. “A ‘material connection’ to the brand includes a personal, family, or employment relationship or a financial relationship — such as the brand paying you or giving you free or discounted products or services.”
Politicians are allowed to receive financial endorsements from other people and businesses, but they must disclose that they received those endorsements.
The question seems to be, should the same be expected of a viral X account?

author: Zonebourse
title: Intempéries en Espagne : les réactions des tour-opérateurs - Zonebourse
text:
Le tour-opérateur Dertour réagit aux intempéries en Espagne. Les voyages peuvent être annulés ou modifiés sans frais jusqu'au 15 novembre, a déclaré Melanie Gerhardt, directrice de la sécurité et de la gestion de crise de l'entreprise. Le trafic aérien risque d'être perturbé, mais les voyageurs à forfait sont parfaitement couverts.
Selon la Fédération allemande du voyage (DRV), les voyageurs à forfait ne sont plus guère présents sur place. La saison est terminée et les vacances d'automne sont terminées dans de nombreux Länder ou en sont à leur dernière semaine. Il n'y a pas de problèmes majeurs pour les touristes allemands.
Dertour : les clients sont tous sains et saufs
"Nous suivons de près les réservations et l'évolution de la situation météorologique", a déclaré Mme Gerhardt, experte de Dertour. En Andalousie, la situation se normalise à vue d'œil, il n'y a plus de restrictions à l'aéroport de Jerez et certains terrains de golf sont à nouveau praticables. "Nos clients sont suivis de près par nos soins et se portent tous bien".
Tui, le plus grand voyagiste du monde, ne se sent guère concerné par les intempéries. Les régions en partie dévastées sont actuellement plutôt visitées par des voyageurs individuels, a déclaré un porte-parole./kge/DP/zb
Partager Accéder à l'article original .
Avertissement légal Avertissement légal

author: @LorraineActu
title: VIDEOS. Orages, dégâts matériels… Les images impressionnantes des inondations dans les Vosges | Lorraine Actu
text:
Voir mon actu Suivre Lorraine Actu Jeudi 1ᵉʳ août 2024, à partir de 17h30, de violents orages ont frappé le département des Vosges , notamment le secteur de Dompaire.
Les fortes précipitations ont entraîné des inondations dans plusieurs communes. Si aucun blessé n’est à signaler, les dégâts matériels sont nombreux , selon la préfecture des Vosges.
À lire aussi
La Lorraine placée en vigilance jaune orages et orange pour les crues : le point sur la situation
190 interventions des pompiers durant la nuit En raison de ces intempéries, des crues ont eu lieu dans la soirée et dans la nuit du jeudi au vendredi sur le tronçon de Madon , placé en vigilance orange crues.
À 7 h du matin, les sapeurs-pompiers étaient intervenus à 190 reprises , notamment dans les communes suivantes : Ville-sur-Illon, Dommartin-aux-Bois, Girancourt, Harol, Légéville-les-Bonfays, Gorhey, Valfroicourt, Damas-et-Bettegney, Dompaire et Chaumousey.
Si une dizaine de personnes ont dû être évacuées, elles ont pu regagner leur domicile ce matin.
Vidéos : en ce moment sur Actu
Le pic de crue atteint cette nuit Selon Vigicrues , le pic de crue « a été atteint à 2h30 ce vendredi » avec une hauteur observée de 3,30 mètres.
Les niveaux sont à la baisse sur le tronçon de Madon et ont permis de rouvrir de la RD 165 et la RD 166. Les axes suivants restent coupés pour le moment :
RD 40 : coupée au niveau du centre du village de Légéville-les-Bonfays RD 6 RD 39 : coupée entre Gorhey et Girancourt D’autres précipitations sont attendues aujourd’hui, vendredi. Néanmoins, « elles ne devraient pas générer de nouvelles réactions sur le tronçon du Madon », précise Vigicrues.
Suivez toute l’actualité de vos villes et médias favoris en vous inscrivant à Mon Actu .
#Inondations #Orages #pluie

author: John Sigler
title: Saints RT Ryan Ramczyk dealing with career-threatening knee injury
text:
Ryan Ramczyk’s injured knee isn’t getting better. The New Orleans Saints right tackle spoke with reporters on Thursday and shared some insight at the uncertainty he’s facing — after missing the last two games (and likely a third this week), all options are on the table. That includes offseason surgery and, worryingly, an early retirement.
The 29-year old has been managing cartilage loss in his knee for years now . He wasn’t able to play in seven games during the 2021 season because of it and was only able to suit up last season after receiving regular injections. This year he’s been given a rest day to start each week’s practice. But time and wear and tear have taken its toll. It’s a really tough break for a player who was so durable to start his career, having missed just one start in his first four years (when he and the rest of the starters were pulled from the meaningless 2018 season finale) before signing a landmark contract extension.
For now Ramczyk is trying to remain patient and follow doctor’s orders. He isn’t expected to play against the Tampa Bay Buccaneers on Sunday and is considered week-to-week while resting and receiving treatment, so he at least has a shot at dressing out for the regular season finale with the Atlanta Falcons.
But the future is unclear. Ramczyk’s career could be over. There’s a possibility he’ll have lifelong knee issues because of this injury. If so, that’s something he’s already accepted, telling ESPN’s Katherine Terrell that “It’s what we sign up for. It’s part of the game, the passion we have to put ourselves through this. It’s worth it.”
What happens if Ramczyk is forced into retirement? Right now, he’s got a salary cap hit counting for north of $27 million in 2024. If the Saints release him outright they would take on more than $32 million in dead money. Their most realistic path forward would be treating his retirement just like they did Drew Brees and Malcolm Jenkins: reducing Ramczyk’s $17 million base salary to the veteran minimum (in his case, $1.21 million) and processing his release as a post-June 1 cut, spreading out the remaining payments from his signing bonus over the 2024 and 2025 seasons.
That would ultimately result in about $16.3 million in dead money for each of those fiscal years, saving $15.79 million against the cap in 2024. But it’s by no means a simple solution. The Saints would have to carry Ramczyk’s $32 million dead money figure against the salary cap through the offseason up until June 2, limiting the moves they could make in free agency ahead of the draft.
Another possibility: asking Ramczyk to return some of his signing bonus. It’s a dirty move for someone who’s already experiencing something as difficult as the premature end of his playing career, but the NFL can be a cold business. There’s precedent for it with players like former San Francisco 49ers linebacker Chris Borland returning most of his signing bonus after a series of concussions, but some teams have taken players to arbitration over it. An arbitrator ruled that former Detroit Lions superstar Barry Sanders had to do just that, and another ex-Lions great, Calvin Johnson, publicly feuded with the team over a similar situation. None of those cases dealt with as much money as what sits between the Saints and Ramczyk. At the same time, an arbitrator may not rule in the team’s favor, making it a fruitless endeavor.
It’s unfortunate that this is what things have come to. Hopefully Ramczyk and the doctors he’s meeting with in the spring can find a way to better manage his knee and help him continue to play at a high level. But there’s a deadline. $6.5 million of Ramczyk’s base salary will become guaranteed on March 15 (the third day of free agency), and the Saints must reach salary cap compliance sooner than that, by March 13 (the start of the new league year). This won’t be a decision anyone involved can put off until the eleventh hour.
Articles Ryan Ramczyk (knee) misses another practice on Saints-Bucs injury report Rookie safety Jordan Howden (illness) misses practice on first Saints-Bucs injury report Michael Thomas, Marshon Lattimore not expected to return vs. Buccaneers Kendre Miller is a surprise add to the Saints inactive list against the Rams
